name: Real_Time_Fraud_Detection_v0 9.pdf
description: In this article, we will explain how to detect fraud amongst online banking customers in real time by running an ensemble of statistical and machine learning algorithms on a dataset of customer transactions and demographic data. The algorithms, namely Logistic Regression, Self-Organizing Maps and Support Vector Machines are operationalized using a multi-agent framework for real time data analysis. This article also explores the cloud environment for real time analytics by deploying the agent framework itself in a cloud environment which meets computational demands by letting users’ provision virtual machines within managed data centers, freeing them from the worry of acquiring and setting up new hardware and networks.
parentName: Real Time Fraud Detection on the Cloud Using Machine Learning Agent Ensembles

name: Customer Churn Management.webmuOBI
description: Churn management is the art of identifying valuable customers, who are likely to churn from a company and executing proactive steps to retain them.

name: MCA_Delivery Engine_Customer Churn_muOBI.link
description:
A deep-dive into the Delivery Engine. The primary objective of the Delivery Engine is to standardize the way we solve problems. It serves as a guiding framework for how problem-solving takes place. The core elements of the Delivery Engine include:
Problem Definition
Data Exploration
Analytical Techniques
Build Solution
Business Interpretation
The video takes the example of customer churn analysis in the telecom industry and how a problem of this scale can be solved by leveraging the Delivery Engine.

description: Reduce Customer Churn Rate muPDNA explains about the different proactive retention measures followed to reduce the churn rate.

name: EoC Search Result Clustering and Visualization.zip
description: This project is a R shiny tool to visualize the artifacts in the search results of EOC  as topic clusters via an beautiful and interactive Voronoi D3 visualization.  The tool uses the tags associated with the artifacts to cluster the artifacts into meaningful topics through a fast-greedy community detection algorithm.

name: Model Operationalization - Survey of Build vs Buy contextual to  Airlines.pdf
description: Several vendors are creating innovative and impressive offerings across the three key pillars of model ops - model development, model deployment, and model monitoring. This paper evaluates some of the most promising model ops platforms across various parameters. It also highlights trade-offs of creating a custom in house platform by stitching together various open source offerings v/s purchasing a product from an external vendor. Finally, it delves into how commercial products can be hybridized with open source offerings to bridge this gap.

name: Ontology_Design_Creation_Vignette.zip
description: The objective of this vignette is to facilitate contextual information retrieval from graph databases created for EoC dataset. This is done by exploring the framework for the design and creation of ontologies in the EoC search space. Subsequently, the created ontologies are stored and queried in Graph databases using Neo4J

name: MCA_HCP assistant for early diagnosis_One Pager.pdf
description: Hard to diagnose disease has a significant impact on both patients and pharmaceutical companies. Mu Sigma developed a framework to visualize the patient-physician journey to better understand the diagnosis path for such diseases. We have incorporated an additional layer to assist physicians in the early diagnosis of such diseases.

name: Tag Extraction From Text.zip
description: In this notebook, several approaches to generate tags for artifacts present on EoC have been explored and validated. The different approaches explored in this notebook include Rapid Automatic Keyword Extraction (RAKE), TextRank, Pointwise Mutual Information Collocations Pattern of Part-of-Speech tags, Keyphrase Extraction Algorithm (KEA).

name: MCA_Delivery Engine_Data Understanding and Treatment for Forecasting.link

Continuation of the Customer Churn problem space exploration as part of the Delivery Engine explainer series. This video covers the primary step which is data understanding and treatment. Different layers of this process include:
Data Understanding
Univariate Analysis
Missing Value Treatment
Outlier Treatment
The video takes the example of customer churn analysis in the telecom industry and how a problem of this scale can be solved by leveraging the Delivery Engine.

name: MCA_muUniverse_Pharma.link
